availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky farmer. Lived in Henry County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Lucy J. Dupuy. Father of Mary E. Dupuy, Joseph Dupuy, Bartholemew Dupuy, Fanny J. Dupuy, Rowland T. Dupuy, Lucy J. Dupuy, Austin Dupuy, Jr., and Perry Dupuy. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in 1860. Involved with the Kentucky State Agricultural Society in 1856. Served as a commissioner to open books for the Eminence and Bethlehem Turnpike Road Company in 1860.

bibl.p: "Report of the Kentucky State Agircultural Society to the Legislature of Kentucky, for the Years 1856 and 1857," Legislative Document, No. 22 (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges, Public Printer, 1857), 29; "An Act to incorporate the Eminence and Bethlehem Turnpike Road Company," Acts of the Generaul Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort, Ky.: Yeoman Office, J. B. Major, State Printer, 1860), 275-277; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 83; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 13.
